body:
Comment 2 by **vendion**: 
I am not sure if my problem is exactly the same, but I am getting errors when trying to
compile Go 1.0.2 from source on my Raspberry Pi using Arch Arm.  The all.bash script
gets to where it tries to build "cmd/go" when I see this:

cmd/go
SIGILL: illegal instruction
PC=0x7bb48

math.initÂ·1()
	/opt/go/src/pkg/math/pow10.go:34 +0x28
math.init()
	/opt/go/src/pkg/math/unsafe.go:21 +0x70
strconv.init()
	/opt/go/src/pkg/strconv/quote.go:441 +0x70
go/parser.init()
	/opt/go/src/pkg/go/parser/parser.go:2349 +0x78
main.init()
	/opt/go/src/cmd/go/vet.go:37 +0x78

goroutine 2 [runnable]:
created by runtime.main
	/opt/go/src/pkg/runtime/proc.c:221

trap    0x6
error   0x0
oldmask 0x0
r0      0x6c9990
r1      0x0
r2      0x0
r3      0x0
r4      0x0
r5      0x0
r6      0x0
r7      0x0
r8      0x0
r9      0x2bbc3c
r10     0x10837000
fp      0x6c95fa
ip      0xcafebabe
sp      0x401ebe44
lr      0x7c0dc
pc      0x7bb48
cpsr    0x20000010
fault   0x0

If this is seperate from this issue, let me know and I can open a new ticket if need be
